title: Music in League of Legends
body:
So today I came across the League of Legends soundcloud page -- https://soundcloud.com/leagueoflegends -- and noticed that there were some pretty good songs throughout created by varying artists.

So my idea, is that these songs are meant to get you pumped in game, so why not create a song for each unique champion and have the song play within the loading screen to not only pass time quicker but get you pumped for the game? Of course there should be an option to turn the music on and off, but I feel as though it would add to the competitive but also artistic/fun side that is League.

Side note: Each champion should have a few songs so it doesn't get repetitive and possibly accompanied by minimal visual effects in the loading screen to match your current song's tempo/feel.

replies.body: or they should just make a option during champ select to play what song or select songs to queue them up.

One song per map or role. No way is league going to get even 2 songs for each champion. That's 2 per champion, so as of the release of Jhin there's 129 champions, which means Riot will have to make 258 songs.

That's more songs than the [Beatles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_songs_recorded_by_the_Beatles) have written in their lifetime. It's extremely unrealistic. Better you just pick your own tracks out of your favorite playlist.
